text: Uganda is expected to compete at the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. Originally scheduled to take place from 24 July to 9 August 2020, the Games have been postponed to 23 July to 8 August 2021, due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Since the nation's official debut in 1956, Ugandan athletes have appeared in every edition of the Summer Olympic Games, with the exception of the 1976 Summer Olympics in Montreal because of its partial support of the African boycott. ==Athletics== Ugandan athletes achieved the entry standards, either by qualifying time or by world ranking, in the following track and field events (up to a maximum of 3 athletes in each event): ;Track & road events ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Albert Chemutai |align=left|3000 m steeplechase | | |colspan=2 | | |-align=center |align=left|Joshua Cheptegei |align=left|5000 m & 10000 m | | |colspan=2 | | |-align=center |align=left|Ronald Musagala |align=left|1500 m | | |colspan=2 | | |-align=center |align=left|Stephen Kissa |align=left|5000 m | | |colspan=2 | | |-align=center |align=left|Abdallah Mande |align=left|10000 m | | | | | | |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font- size:95%" !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Esther Chebet |align=left|1500 m | | | | | | |-align=center |align=left|Sarah Chelangat |align=left|5000 m | | |colspan=2 | | |-align=center |align=left|Peruth Chemutai |align=left|3000 m steeplechase | | |colspan=2 | | |-align=center |align=left|Stella Chesang |align=left|5000 m | | |colspan=2 | | |-align=center |align=left|Halimah Nakaayi |align=left|800 m | | | | | | |-align=center |align=left|Winnie Nanyondo |align=left|1500 m | | |colspan=2 | | |-align=center |align=left|Juliet Chekwel |align=left|Marathon | | | | | | |} ==Boxing== Uganda entered one boxer into the Olympic tournament. Shadiri Bwogi scored a box-off victory to secure a spot in the men's welterweight division at the 2020 African Qualification Tournament in Diamniadio, Senegal. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !Round of 32 !Round of 16 !Quarterfinals !Semifinals !colspan=2|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Shadiri Bwogi |align=left|Men's welterweight | | | | | | |} ==Rowing== Uganda qualified one boat in the women's single sculls for the Games rowed by Kathleen Grace Noble by topping the field in the B-final and securing the third of five berths available at the 2019 FISA African Olympic Qualification Regatta in Tunis, Tunisia, marking the country's debut in the sport. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heats !colspan="2"|Repechage !colspan="2"|Quarterfinals !colspan="2"|Semifinals !colspan="2"|Final |- style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Kathleen Grace Noble |align=left|Women's single sculls |align=left| |align=left| | | | | |align=left| |align=left| |align=left| |align=left| |} Qualification Legend: FA=Final A (medal); FB=Final B (non-medal); FC=Final C (non-medal); FD=Final D (non-medal); FE=Final E (non-medal); FF=Final F (non-medal); SA/B=Semifinals A/B; SC/D=Semifinals C/D; SE/F=Semifinals E/F; QF=Quarterfinals; R=Repechage ==References== Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Olympics 2020
title: Uganda at the 2020 Summer Olympics
